1 Introduction

1.1 Scope

The scope of the Security Test Plan (STP) is to ensure that there is a complete end-to-end integration testing of SAMS with dependent connections to secured working systems. It is also to ensure that all entities within management, implementation, operational, and oversight responsibilities have a clear understanding of their roles and associated functions with SAMS.

1.2 Background

SAMS will provide a mode of communication between Executives, Directors of Field Operations, Port Directors, and Port Officers. The application will allow HQ Executives to send emergency notifications and simple text notifications to Port Officers and get acknowledgements of the messages received. The application will have location targeting abilities as well, which will allow for communications to specific Field Offices and specific Port Director.

4 Scope of Testing

The following sections define the scope of testing, which include Features to be tested, Features not to be tested, assumptions for test execution, test completion criteria, test completion criteria.

4.1 Controls to be Tested

The following section outlines the controls that will be tested which include, AC - Access Controls, AU - Auditing, CA- Security Assessment and Authorization, CM - Configuration Management, CP - Contingency Planning, IA - Identification and Authentication, IR - Incident Response, MP - Media Protection, PL - Security Planning, RA - Risk Assessment, SA - System and Services Acquisition, SC - System and Communications Proftection and SI - System and Information Integrity.

Below is the Test Plan for the controls that will be tested.

4.2 Controls not to be Tested

TBD

4.3 Assumptions For Test Execution

Before starting to test the following conditions should be met:

  • The test environment is ready and configured appropriately.
  • The version to be tested has been successfully deployed to the test environment.
  • All the features planned for the build are ready to be tested.
  • Smoke test has been passed successfully.

If one of the above mentioned items is not fulfilled the QA Team Lead returns the build to the development team for correction

4.4 Test Completion Criteria

  • All test cases planned for execution have been run
  • All the found defects have been reported to the bug tracking system.
  • A test result report has been sent to all interested parties.

5 Test Strategy

This section outlines the type of testing to be conducted.

6 Scanning Authorization

Any scans performed by the assessment team must be approved in advance by the system owner. The letter in Appendix A must be signed by the system owner and forwarded to the Assessment Team prior to conducting the assessment. This letter will authorize the Assessment team to use the tools indicated to perform scans on SAMS.
